story:
Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there was a beautiful and peaceful valley surrounded by towering mountains. The valley was known as the Valley of the Golden Sun, because the sun would rise each morning and fill the valley with a warm, golden light. In the heart of the valley stood a magnificent palace made of white marble, adorned with intricate carvings and shimmering with gold and precious stones.

The palace was home to a kind and just king, named Shah Jamal. Shah Jamal was loved by all his people, for he was wise and fair, and always made sure that everyone in his kingdom was happy and well taken care of. He had a beautiful queen, named Noor, who was known throughout the land for her radiant beauty and her kind heart. Together, they had a lovely daughter named Zulaikha, who was the joy of their lives.

Zulaikha was a curious and adventurous little girl, with a heart full of love and compassion. She loved exploring the palace gardens, playing with the palace pets, and listening to the stories of the wise old men who lived in the palace. But most of all, she loved hearing her father's tales of far-off lands and fantastical creatures.

One day, as Zulaikha was sitting in her father's lap, listening to one of his stories, she looked up at him and said, "Father, I wish I could see all the wondrous things you speak of. I want to explore the world and have grand adventures of my own."

Shah Jamal smiled at his daughter and replied, "My dear Zulaikha, one day you will see the world and have the adventures you long for. But for now, why don't we explore the palace gardens together? I'm sure we will find many wonders there."

So, the next day, Shah Jamal and Zulaikha set off on an adventure through the palace gardens. They walked through forests of fragrant flowers, past sparkling fountains, and beneath ancient trees that whispered secrets to the wind. They saw butterflies as bright as jewels, birds that sang the sweetest melodies, and even a family of deer that came to greet them.

As they walked, Zulaikha asked her father, "Father, how did the palace gardens come to be so beautiful?"

Shah Jamal smiled and said, "Long ago, when the world was young, a great and powerful genie lived in the valley. The genie had the power to create anything he desired, and he was lonely. So, he created a beautiful garden, filled with all manner of plants and animals, and he made his home in the heart of it.

But the genie was not content to keep his garden to himself. He wanted to share its beauty with others, so he invited all the creatures of the world to come and live in his garden. And they came, in droves, and the garden became a place of wonder and enchantment.

But the genie grew old, and one day he knew that his time on this earth was coming to an end. So, he summoned all the creatures of the garden and said to them, 'When I am gone, I want you to continue to care for this garden and to share its beauty with the world. And in return, I will grant each of you a wish.'

The creatures were overjoyed, and they promised to care for the garden and share its beauty with the world. And the genie, true to his word, granted each of them a wish.

And that, my dear Zulaikha, is how the palace gardens came to be. The genie's wish-granting power lives on in the gardens, and as long as the creatures of the garden continue to care for it and share its beauty with the world, the gardens will remain a place of wonder and magic."

Zulaikha was amazed by her father's story, and she promised to help care for the palace gardens and share its beauty with the world. And so, she and Shah Jamal continued to explore the gardens, making new discoveries and having grand adventures at every turn.

From that day on, Zulaikha knew that the palace gardens were a magical place, and she would often return to them, seeking new wonders and adventures. And as she grew older, she would share the stories of the garden with her own children, passing on the legacy of the genie and the magic of the palace gardens.

And so, the Valley of the Golden Sun and the palace gardens continued to be a place of beauty and wonder, filled with the magic of the genie and the love and care of the creatures who lived there. And everyone who visited
